Home → Events and activities → Slaughter in Southwold

Slaughter in Southwold

Saturday 16 and Sunday 17 June 2018, Southwold Arts Centre

Join us for a feast of author talks, activities, food and film screenings. Tickets on sale from Southwold Library and Ticketsource from 1 April. £5 per author talk, £15 for a day pass, or £30 for the weekend.

Author talks - Saturday 16 June

Edward Wilson

1000

Edward Wilson will be talking about his spy novels, set in the Cold War and featuring rather reluctant MI6 officer Catesby. Suffolk is at the core of these novels; Catesby hails from the county, and returns there at times of trouble.

Simon Scarrow

1130

Simon Scarrow will be talking about his latest thriller, Playing With Death. Written with Lee Francis, it is both an edge-of-your-seat thriller and a terrifying exploration of the dangers of the modern world.

Robert Goddard

1400

Robert Goddard will be talking about his 27th thriller, Panic Room.

Mary-Jane Riley

1530

Mary-Jane Riley will be talking about her Alex Devlin series, set in Suffolk and Norfolk.

Author Talks - Sunday 17 June

Peter Guttridge

1000

Peter Guttridge presents “Crimewriters and Other Liars”, a talk about the world of crime writing past and present and his experiences with crime writers, his own writing and at other crime writing festivals.

Stella Rimington

1130

Dame Stella Rimington will be talking about her Liz Carlyle spy series.

Sophie Hannah

1400

Sophie will be discussing the influence of Agatha Christie on her writing and sharing the stories behind her three Poirot novels, including the forthcoming The Mystery of Three Quarters.

Mark Billingham & Martyn Waites

1530

Crime fiction heavyweights Mark Billingham and Martyn Waites will be discussing their impressive combined ouevre, including Mark’s Tom Thorne series and Martyn’s Brennan and Esposito series, written as Tania Carver.

Activities

Murder Mystery Night: The Wenlock Mummy, by Elly Griffiths

Fri 15 Jun, 1900

Enjoy a delicious meal from Café 51 and test your abilities as a sleuth with this murder mystery from the pen of bestselling author Elly Griffiths, featuring her beloved Dr Ruth Galloway and DCI Harry Nelson.

Elementary My Dear Watson: fun crime quiz night

Sat 16 Jun, 1900

Get together a team of 4 and take part in our fun quiz, with rounds on crime from TV, films and books, suitable for all.

Food

Lunch can be murder, with Cafe 51

Sat 16 Jun, 1300

Have lunch, cake and hot drinks with authors visiting for Slaughter in Southwold.

Lunch: Something Fishy

Sun 17 Jun, 1300–1400

Have lunch, cake and hot drinks with the authors visiting for Slaughter in Southwold.

Classic crime film double bills

Classic crime film double bill: The Big Sleep & Key Largo

Wed 13 Jun, 1400 & 1600

Join us for a classic crime double bill as part of the Slaughter in Southwold crime writers’ festival.

Classic crime film double bill: Touch of Evil & The Third Man

Wed 13 Jun, 1900 & 2045

Join us for a classic crime double bill as part of the Slaughter in Southwold crime writers’ festival.

Classic crime film double bill: Strangers on a Train & Dial M for Murder

Thu 14 Jun, 1900 & 2045

Join us for a classic crime double bill as part of the Slaughter in Southwold crime writers’ festival.

Classic crime film double bill: Double Indemnity & The Postman Always Rings Twice

Fri 15 Jun, 1400 & 1600

Join us for a classic crime double bill as part of the Slaughter in Southwold crime writers’ festival.
